intro: Mitragyna chevalieri, commonly known as the African kratom, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing elliptical seeds. Its leaves are typically ovate with a waxy texture and contain alkaloids similar to those found in kratom. Due to its potential medicinal properties, it has attracted interest for research in various therapeutic applications.
